results.title: Dazed and confused
results.creator_credit: Richard Linklater, Sean Daniel, James Jacks and Gramercy Pictures
results.brief_description: Taking place on the last day of school in 1974 this coming-of-age comedy drama is a interesting look at 70’s youth culture. From nerds to footballers this story follows students seeking fun involving the usual booze, drugs and parties within a random storyline. Not just the usual teen flick “Dazed and Confused” is seen as a realist portrayal of the teenage years where a party is the main destination. Cast includes Milla Jovovich, Jason London, Joey Lauren Adams, Ben Affleck, Matthew McConaughey and Parker Posey.

results.title: Days of wine and roses
results.creator_credit: Blake Edwards, Martin Manulis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Two-time Oscar winner Jack Lemmon is brilliant as Joe Clay, a public relations man who considers himself to be a social drinker but socialising is the mainstay of his work. The sweet Kirsten (played by Lee Remick) marries him and starts drinking to keep him company. This film searingly portrays the couple’s downward spiral into alcoholic oblivion. A powerful script and unforgettable acting lend believability to this poignant, heart-rending story. Nominated for five Oscars and receiving one for the haunting title song, the film also co-stars Jack Klugman and boasts music by Henry Mancini. Originally a teleplay by J. P. Miller.

results.title: Days of Heaven
results.creator_credit: Terrence Malick, Harold Schneider, Siobhan Bowers and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: This visually sumptuous film is the story of three young slum dwellers who are forced to leave Chicago and search for work in the wheat fields of Texas. It is the turn-of-the-century and the depression has created enormous poverty. Bill (Richard Gere) forms a plan to inherit the fortune of his employer, and secure a future for his girlfriend (Brooke Adams) and sister (Linda Manz). This sets in train a chain of deceit and betrayal which leads to tragedy. The cinematography of the stark Texas landscape is by Academy Award winning Nestor Alemandros. The film also stars writer Sam Shepard. Critically “Days of Heaven” has been acclaimed as a leading film of the 1970’s Hollywood “new wave”.

results.title: Days of reckoning
results.creator_credit: Ron Tanner, Lloyds Bank and Millbank Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Starting your own business”.
The third and final part of the series, Starting Your Own Business which traces the fortunes of three people starting their own businesses. Examines the only surviving member of the trio, an engineer whose business is in its third year. He is presented with the opportunity to expand and must reach a quick decision. Focuses on forward planning and monitoring performance.

results.title: Days I'll remember in South Australia
results.creator_credit: Howard Rubie, Peter Dimond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The star quality of the state of South Australia and one of its daughters, Julie Anthony, is revealed in this prestigious tourist film. Specially conceived music, and superb visuals combine to present the major tourist attractions of South Australia. The River Murray, Port Lincoln, the Barossa Valley, the Adelaide Hills, the Flinders Ranges, and the city of Adelaide are featured. Julie Anthony’s singing adds a special dimension to the whole film

results.title: Our children : Video package
results.creator_credit: Rachel Dixon, Film Victoria and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: A Child Protection Package to train professionals who are in regular contact with children. Divided into 5 segments: 1: Defining abuse 2:Difficulties in reporting 3:Early detection and support 4:Networking for information exchange and case management 5:On-going responsibility for prevention, protection and support between family, CSV and professionals. Accompanied by 43p. Leader’s Guide including 8 overhead transparencies. The Leader’s Guide should be used in conjunction with the video. It gives background information as well as discussion questions and issues relevant to each segment.

results.title: Otway countdown
results.creator_credit: John Bird, Don Dennett and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A student production making a clear statement of the conservationists viewpoint of clearfelling and woodchopping of valuable native forests. It examines the history of the Otways and argues strongly against current practices. This film could be used in conjunction with films and resources giving the alternative viewpoints to stimulate debate on resource management.

results.title: Ottawa, today and tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Planning experts redesigning Ottawa consider its potentialities as a national capital. Animation shows how it began as a lumbering town at the junction of three rivers. Points out some of its undesirable features and shows the master plan embodying good town-planning principles and highlighting its scenic waterways, drives, and Houses of Parliament.

results.title: Day of the dead (D)
results.creator_credit: George A. Romero, Richard Rubinstein, Laurel Productions and United Film Distribution Company
results.brief_description: The third and bleakest of George A. Romero’s ‘Living dead’ series (which consist of ‘Night of the living dead’ and ‘Dawn of the dead’), is also the most goriest. Essentially, society has collapsed and the living dead have taken over the world. The film picks up on a small group of survivors, made up of scientists and a small band of soldiers who have barricaded themselves in an abandoned missile silo. The scientists desperately search for a solution to the zombie plague, while the military become increasingly agitated at their lack of results. Like Romero’s previous outings into the world of the undead, the varied groups are microcosms of human nature and not surprisingly, the most unpleasant characters in this film are not the zombies but the humans themselves. Cast includes Lori Cardille, Terry Alexander, Joe Pilato, Richard Liberty and Howard Sherman.

results.title: Day after day
results.creator_credit: Clement Perron, Hubert Aquin, Victor Jobin, Fernand Dansereau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A look at life in a small paper-milling town in Quebec where most of the 6,500 inhabitants derive their livelihood from the one industry. Day after day the same work, the same hours, the same machines, the same product, until the entire routine of living becomes but a reflection of the dominant routines of the mill. The commentary is made up largely of fragments of thoughts which might be running through the minds of the mill workers - this is the film’s theme as it probes to the very core of company-town life. (Awards: Toronto, San Francisco, Montreal, Chicago, New York)
